result.execSummary:
The defendant Shamar Lee Shaw was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: -Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharge (unless previously paid) to be paid from prison funds in the amount found appropriate, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment.

03-22-2018-Correction to JOC dated 03-13-2017:
Court ordered the term of Initial Confinement is 2 years and 6 months, the term of extended supervision is 2 years
Concurrent with: with case 16CF1962,  credit for 329 days time served.
*Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program AND the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after 18 months of confinement.

superMiscConds.notes:
-No new law violations rising to the level or probable cause.
-No driving without a valid drivers license.

supervisions.notes:
-No contact with firearms.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shamar Lee Shaw

records.addlTxt: Filed and Distributed;  Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment  pursuant to Wis. Stats. Sec. 973.195 is DENIED because the defendant's previous petition for sentence adjustment was denied. Only one petition may be filed.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Pedro A. Colon, Br. 18, for review. mag
Second petition filed on count one.  (Return Address:  Shamar L. Shaw #590508, Fox Lake Correctional Institution, P.O. Box 200, Fox Lake, WI  53933).
reflects correction (req by SC) to term of Initial Confinement  from 2 yrs to 2 yrs 6 mos.

Signed, Filed, and Distributed; Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment  pursuant to Wis. Stats. Sec. 973.195 is DENIED because it is not in the public interest.  Written reasons included in signed order of the Court.

Bail refund packet.  vp

Defendant Shamar Lee Shaw in court with attorney Scott r Winkler.  Defendant Shamar Lee Shaw in custody.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 4 YEARS and 6 MONTHS, concurrent to case 16CF1962, credit for 329 days time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 2 YEARS and 6 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-No new law violations rising to the level or probable cause.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-No driving without a valid drivers license.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharge (unless previously paid) to be paid from prison funds in the amount found appropriate, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment.
-Provide DNA Sample unless previously provided.

*Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program AND the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after 18 months of confinement.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement.
Received and Filed, Letters on behalf of defendant.
Order for Remand and Revocatoin of Bail, signed and filed.

Attorney Scott r Winkler in court, defendant Shamar Lee Shaw not in court, in custody.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a sentencing hearing date.  Neither party wishes to address the court on the record.  Case adjourned to Branch 18.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 9, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shamar Lee Shaw in court with attorney Scott r Winkler.  Defendant Shamar Lee Shaw in custody.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.

At the hour of 3:30 pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.  Case adjourned for status conference.  Status conference scheduled for January 12, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shamar Lee Shaw in court with attorney Scott r Winkler.  Defendant Shamar Lee Shaw in custody.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
In chambers discussion placed on the record.  

At the hour of 9:16 am jury back in box.  Trial proceeded.  
Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 9:57 am to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Koch and Bacon who were duly sworn for that purpose.

Defendant Shamar Lee Shaw in court with attorney Scott r Winkler.  Defendant Shamar Lee Shaw in custody.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
In-chambers discussions regarding preliminary instructions placed on the record. 

At the hour of 2:14 pm jury back in box. for continued voir dire.  Court instructed jury.  Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.   Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  MPD Detective Joel Susman, MPD Officer Ryan deWitt.  Exhibits 1, 2, 3 received.  

Jury out of box at 3:40 pm.  Sidebar placed on the record.  Jury back in box at 3:56 pm.  Continued testimony of Officer deWitt.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Defense rests.  Testimony closed.  At the hour of 4:24 pm jury dismissed for the day, but ordered to return at 8:30 am on 1-10-2017.

Stipulation placed on the record.  Case adjourned to Branch 18.  Jury trial scheduled for January 10, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  11:06 am.    At the hour of 11:55 am jury dismissed for lunch, but ordered to return at 1:30 pm.

Attorney Scott r Winkler in court, defendant Shamar Lee Shaw not in court, in custody.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case calendared for jury trial today.  Both parties advised the Court that they are ready to proceed.  Parties discussed how the trial will proceed.  Case passed.

Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing, final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 18.  Motion hearing scheduled for December 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 9, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Benjamin T Van Severen for Scott R Winkler in court, defendant Shamar Lee Shaw not in court, in custody.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a status conference.  Parties requested an adjournment so that both cases can be joined and disposed of together and for Attorney Winkler to withdraw.  Matter is adjourned to August 17, 2016 at 1:30pm in Br. 18, Judge Colon's court.

ALL PARTIES WERE NOTIFIED AS OF AUGUST 1, 2016, THIS CASE WILL BE REASSIGNED TO JUDGE PEDRO COLON, BRANCH #18, IN ROOM 635 OF THE COURTHOUSE, DUE TO JUDICIAL ROTATION.

Defendant Shamar Lee Shaw in court with attorney Scott r Winkler.  Defendant Shamar Lee Shaw in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Shamar Lee Shaw in court with attorney Paul James Manley.  Defendant Shamar Lee Shaw in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin  Deputy Court Clerk: LM.  
Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #12CF1300 that are attached to the complaint.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
